accessibility_text:
## Accessibility

### Wheelchairs

BAMPFA is wheelchair accessible. Wheelchairs are available at the admissions desk for visitor use on a first-come, first-served basis. The building has an elevator that serves all floors as well as the Barbro Osher Theater.

### Service Animals

Service Dogs are always allowed on campus grounds and in campus buildings. [More information on University policy regarding service animals.](https://dac.berkeley.edu/resources/visitors/visitor-faq)[  
](https://dac.berkeley.edu/resources/visitors/visitor-faq)

### Large Print Labels

Booklets of large print exhibition text are available for select exhibitions. Booklets can be found at the entrance to the exhibition gallery or requested at the admissions desk.

### Accessible Theater Seating

BAMPFA's theaters have a limited number of disability companion seats and wheelchair locations with preferred viewing sightlines. You can purchase tickets for wheelchair accessible locations online or at our front desk.

### Assistive Listening Devices for Theater Screenings

Assistive listening devices are available for all film programs and are t-coil compatible. They are available at the admissions desk on a first-come, first-served basis prior to any screening.

### Closed Captions & Audio Descriptions for Theater Screenings

The Barbro Osher Theater (BAMPFA's primary film theater) is equipped for closed captioning and audio description services. Screenings with closed captioning and audio descriptions avail...
collections_text:
[](/program/theresa-hak-kyung-cha-multiple-offerings)

Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, Still from _Permutations_ , 1976. 16mm film; black and white, silent, 10 min. Gift of the Theresa Hak Kyung Cha Memorial Foundation.

# [Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Multiple Offerings](/program/theresa-hak-kyung-cha-multiple-offerings)

**Opens January 24, 2026**

Discover the inventive, playful, and meditative works of groundbreaking artist Theresa Hak Kyung Cha. Gathering over one hundred artworks and archival materials from across her short but prolific career, as well as select loans of works by Cha and other artists, the exhibition highlights Cha’s practice while also situating her work within a constellation of other artists for whom she has long been a lodestar. [Learn more→](/program/theresa-hak-kyung-cha-multiple-offerings)
